page.title: 11Baggeridge Country Park (1)
page.content: {Baggeridge Country Park}covers{152 {acres}and lies on the{site}of {Baggeridge Colliery}which closed in {1967.In 1970}it was designated as a {country park}and work began a year later.From{1970}to{1980}the land was bought with grants from the {Countryside Commission District {Council}and the{Department of the {Environment.The reclamation contract began in{January 1981,}and over the following{two years 375,000 square {metres}of earth was{moved; 80,000 {tonnes}of{coal slurry}was taken from the site for re-use by{power stations, including{40,000 cubic metres}from the {pools.6.2km of paths}were made plus another{3.4km of bridal}track.Nearly {20,000 shrubs}and{trees}were planted, along with{3250kg}of{grass seed including{wild flowers}and{special {grasses.
